com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core

Class FactorTableBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core.FactorTableBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFactorTable, IFactorTableBase, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<FactorTableEntry>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SparseFactorTableBase

    @NotThreadSafe
public abstract class FactorTableBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFactorTableBase, IFactorTable

      • density

        public double density()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        That ratio of non-zero weights to IFactorTableBase.jointSize(). Will be 1.0 if table contains no entries with zero weight.
        Specified by:
        density in interface IFactorTableBase

      • getDimensions

        public final int getDimensions()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        The number of dimensions in the table.

        The same as IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().size().

        Specified by:
        getDimensions in interface IFactorTableBase

      • getDomainIndexer

        public final JointDomainIndexer getDomainIndexer()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        The domain indexer for the table represents the domains of the table dimensions and denotes the directionality of the table dimensions if table is directed.

        It is used to map between different representations identifying a table entry: i.e. array of elements of each respective domain, array of discrete domain indices of each respective domain, or a single integer representing the location of the entry in the dense representation of the table.

        Specified by:
        getDomainIndexer in interface IFactorTableBase

      • getInputSet

        @Nullable
public final java.util.BitSet getInputSet()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        If IFactorTableBase.isDirected() returns object indicating the indices of the subset of dimensions/domains that represent inputs or the "from" size of the directionality. Returns null if table is not directed. The output set is simply the inverse of the input set (i.e. represented by the clear bits instead of the set bits).
        Specified by:
        getInputSet in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getOutputSet()

      • getOutputSet

        @Nullable
public final java.util.BitSet getOutputSet()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        If IFactorTableBase.isDirected() returns object indicating the indices of the subset of dimensions/domains that represent outputs or the "to" size of the directionality. Returns null if table is not directed. The input set is simply the inverse of the output set (i.e. represented by the clear bits instead of the set bits).
        Specified by:
        getOutputSet in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.getInputSet()

      • createTableConditionedOn

        public IFactorTable createTableConditionedOn(int[] valueIndices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Constructs a new factor table by conditioning one or more dimensions conditioned on specified values.

        The new table will not be directed and will have the same representation as the original table except that FactorTableRepresentation.DETERMINISTIC will become FactorTableRepresentation.SPARSE_ENERGY.

        Specified by:
        createTableConditionedOn in interface IFactorTable
        Parameters:
        valueIndices - is an array of length IFactorTableBase.getDimensions() that specifies which dimensions are to be conditioned away. Each entry in the array should either be a negative value if the dimension is to be retained, or a non-negative value in the range [0, dimension-size - 1].

      • sparseIndexFromElements

        public int sparseIndexFromElements(java.lang.Object... elements)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Computes sparse index for the table entry associated with the specified arguments.

        Specified by:
        sparseIndexFromElements in interface IFactorTableBase
        Parameters:
        elements - must have length equal to IFactorTableBase.getDimensions() and each argument must be an element of the corresponding domain.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromIndices(int[]), IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromElements(Object[])

      • sparseIndexFromIndices

        public int sparseIndexFromIndices(int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Computes a sparse index for the table entry associated with the specified indices.
        Specified by:
        sparseIndexFromIndices in interface IFactorTableBase
        Parameters:
        indices - must have length equal to IFactorTableBase.getDimensions() and each index must be a non-negative value less than the corresponding domain size otherwise the function could return an incorrect result.
        Returns:
        sparse index for table entry with given set of indices. Returns negative value if there is no such entry.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromElements(java.lang.Object...), IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexToIndices(int, int[])

      • sparseIndexToElements

        public java.lang.Object[] sparseIndexToElements(int sparseIndex,
                                       @Nullable
                                       java.lang.Object[] elements)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        Computes domain values corresponding to given joint index.

        Specified by:
        sparseIndexToElements in interface IFactorTableBase
        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - index in the range [0,IFactorTableBase.sparseSize()).
        elements - if this is an array of length IFactorTableBase.getDimensions(), the computed values will be placed in this array, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexToIndices(int, int[]), IFactorTableBase.sparseIndexFromElements(Object...)

      • isDirected

        public boolean isDirected()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if table has designated input/output domains directed, in which case IFactorTableBase.getInputSet() will be non-null.

        For most applications the table should have weights normalized so that IFactorTableBase.isConditional() also is true.

        Specified by:
        isDirected in interface IFactorTableBase

      • jointSize

        public int jointSize()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        The number of possible combinations of the values of all the domains in this table. Same as JointDomainIndexer.getCardinality() of IFactorTableBase.getDomainIndexer().
        Specified by:
        jointSize in interface IFactorTableBase
        See Also:
        IFactorTableBase.sparseSize()

      • supportsJointIndexing

        public final boolean supportsJointIndexing()
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTableBase
        True if table supports operations involving jointIndex values or dense representation. If false, then methods that return or use such arguments will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Specified by:
        supportsJointIndexing in interface IFactorTableBase

      • randomizeWeights

        public void randomizeWeights(java.util.Random rand)
        Description copied from interface: IFactorTable
        Randomize the weights of the table depending on underlying representation.

        If table IFactorTableBase.hasDenseRepresentation() this will randomly assign weights/energies to entries for all joint indexes, otherwise it will only assign values for all sparse indexes. Weights will be assigned uniformly from the range (0,1].

        Specified by:
        randomizeWeights in interface IFactorTable
